name: Contract & Supplier Finder
description: Helps procurement officers quickly find past contracts, supplier information, pricing history, and performance records across procurement documentation.

friction_addressed.description: Finding past contracts and supplier data scattered across multiple SharePoint sites, folders, and systems
Switching between contract repository, supplier database, and email to piece together vendor history
Locating contracts approaching renewal or expiration

value_proposition.primary_benefit: Instant access to contract and supplier information without manual searching
secondary_benefits: Faster response to internal stakeholder inquiries
Better preparation for supplier negotiations with historical context
Reduced risk of missed contract renewals
Consistent access to approved supplier information

required.name: OneDriveAndSharePoint
required.reason: Agent needs access to contract repository, supplier documentation, and procurement records stored in SharePoint
required.setup_instructions: Configure with SharePoint sites/folders containing: (1) executed contracts, (2) supplier/vendor files, (3) RFP responses, (4) performance evaluations

optional.name: Email
optional.reason: Can search email for supplier correspondence and negotiation history
optional.setup_instructions: Enable if procurement team wants to include email search in supplier lookups

optional.name: GraphConnectors
optional.reason: Can connect to ERP or contract management systems via Graph connectors
optional.setup_instructions: Configure if organization has Graph connectors for procurement systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle)

actions.description: This agent is retrieval-only. It helps find and summarize existing information but does not create, modify, or take action on contracts or supplier records.

conversation_starters.title: Find a contract
conversation_starters.text: Find our current contract with [supplier name]

conversation_starters.title: Supplier lookup
conversation_starters.text: What do we have on file for [supplier name]?

conversation_starters.title: Pricing history
conversation_starters.text: What pricing have we had with [supplier] over the past 2 years?

conversation_starters.title: Expiring contracts
conversation_starters.text: Which contracts are expiring in the next 90 days?

conversation_starters.title: Past RFP responses
conversation_starters.text: Find RFP responses we received for [category] last year

conversation_starters.title: Supplier performance
conversation_starters.text: What's the performance history for [supplier name]?

prerequisites: SharePoint site or folder structure containing procurement contracts
Supplier/vendor documentation accessible via SharePoint or OneDrive
User deploying the agent must have read access to the configured locations
Microsoft 365 Copilot license for users who will use the agent

data_not_accessed: Financial systems (ERP) unless Graph connector configured
admin_considerations: Ensure SharePoint permissions align with who should access contract information
Consider scoping to specific folders if some contracts are highly sensitive
Review what historical data should be included vs. archived
Audit agent usage if contract data is subject to compliance requirements
